intro: Geissanthus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed geissanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
